page.title: 16HENLLAN PARISH CHURCH
page.content: The present church _ dedicated to St. Sadwrn _ was erected in the 15thc. on the site of an earlier building.The tower is separate: it dates from the 11thc.and lies on a spur of rock in the N.E. corner of the churchyard.This spot was probably chosen to project the sound of the bells. "Henllan church and Henllan steeple, Are true emblems of Henllan people, All at variance; what's the wonder When church&steeple are far asunder" (18thc wag). The church fabric is awaiting its 3rd restoration.A Fund to raise Â£30000 was launched in April 1984. Of note: earliest gravestone,1614; registers begin 1684; almshouses built 1814; first vicar,1462. The present rector's living includes the parishes of Llannefydd & Bylchau.
